hw_name.description: This is the VESC Logging and Communication Module.

kp.description:
P (Proportional) value for the Angle PID balance loop.

Recommended Values: 10 - 35

ki.description:
I (Integral) value for the Angle PID balance loop.

Recommended Values: 0.005 - 0.08

kp2.description:
P (Proportional) value for the Rate PID balance loop.

Recommended Values: 0.1 - 0.6

(0.7 - 1.2+ is possible, may experience negative side effects)


*NOTE: Added to Angle PID, rather than the Cascading PID's of the stock Balance Package

ki2.description:
I (Integral) value for the Rate PID balance loop.

Recommended Values: 0 - 0.04

(Largely untested, can experience negative side effects at highest permitted values)


*NOTE: Added to Angle PID, rather than the Cascading PID's of the stock Balance Package

hertz.description:
Frequency of Balance Loop Cycle

Recommended Value: Same or multiple of IMU Sample Rate

  • Little FOCer v3.1 (LSM6DS3): 832Hz
  • Little FOCer v3 (BMI160): 800Hz

fault_pitch.description: Angle to turn off driving (on the pitch axis).

fault_roll.description: Angle to turn off driving (on the roll axis).

fault_adc1.description: Voltage below this value will trigger a fault. To disable this switch set this value to 0. Hint: consider a pulldown resisitor!

fault_adc2.description: Voltage below this value will trigger a fault. To disable this switch set this value to 0. Hint: consider a pulldown resisitor!

fault_delay_pitch.description: Pitch fault cutoff time delay in ms.

fault_delay_roll.description: Roll fault cutoff time delay in ms.

fault_delay_switch_half.description: Half switch cutoff time delay in ms.

fault_delay_switch_full.description: Full switch cutoff time delay in ms.

fault_adc_half_erpm.description: ERPM (absoulte value) below which a half state on the ADC switches will be considered a fault.

fault_is_dual_switch.description: Treat both sensors as a single one, i.e. startup only requires one of the sensors, and heel lifts aren't possible (for advanced riders only!).

fault_darkride_enabled.description:
Allows you to ride the board upside down without sensors. Simple Stop (disengage when rolling backwards) is active when using Darkride to allow safe dismount and prevent ghosting.


*NOTE: Requires correct speed calibration!! The board WILL ghost for sure if your normal speeds are negative!!

fault_reversestop_enabled.description:
Allows stopping the onewheel gently by going backwards a bit. Will slowly tilt until it exceeds 15 degrees, and then turn off. It will also stop if going in reverse and staying above 5 degrees tilt for 1+ seconds, or above 10 degrees tilt for 0.5+ seconds.


*NOTE: Requires correct speed calibration!! You WON'T be able to go forward if your normal speeds are negative!!


*DISCLAIMER: With Reverse Stop enabled, it's much harder if not impossible to balance standing still

tiltback_duty_angle.description: Angle of rise for duty cycle tiltback.

tiltback_duty_speed.description: Speed at which vehicle is being tilted back when exceeding duty cycle limit (fast tiltback can be dangerous!).

tiltback_duty.description: Duty cycle threshold to trigger a safety tiltback (Tiltback raises the nose of the vehicle informing you to slow down).

tiltback_hv_angle.description: Angle of rise for high voltage tiltback.

tiltback_hv_speed.description: Speed at which vehicle is being tilted back when exceeding high voltage limit (fast tiltback can be dangerous!).

tiltback_hv.description: High voltage threshold to trigger a safety tiltback (Tiltback raises the nose of the vehicle to alert you). High voltage tiltback is most likely to be triggered when braking or going downhill on a full battery, sometimes resulting in a tail drag on board shaped vehicles.

tiltback_lv_angle.description: Angle of rise for low voltage tiltback.

tiltback_lv_speed.description: Speed at which vehicle is being tilted back when below low voltage threshold (fast tiltback can be dangerous and further contribute to voltage sag!).

tiltback_lv.description: Low voltage threshold to trigger a safety tiltback (Tiltback raises the nose of the vehicle informing you to slow down).

tiltback_return_speed.description: Speed at which vehicle is being returned back to normal after a tiltback condition has been cleared (should be equal to or slower than slowest tiltback speed).

tiltback_constant.description: Tiltback that will be applied above a configurable minimum ERPM. AKA nose angle adjustment, can be downwards too.

tiltback_constant_erpm.description: ERPM (absolute value) above which constant tiltback will be applied.

tiltback_variable.description: Nose angle adjustment that will be applied depending on speed, specified in degrees per 1000 erpm, applied linearly up to a maximum set in Variable Tiltback Maximum. Can be downwards (negative) too. Applies in addition to constant tiltback.

tiltback_variable_max.description: Maximum angle which variable tiltback is permitted to add (in addition to constant tiltback). Does not affect or prevent alert tiltbacks.

noseangling_speed.description: Speed at which vehicle will tilt to the desired angle.

inputtilt_remote_type.description:
Select how the remote's reciever communicates with VESC (PPM or UART).


*CAUTION: REQUIRES CUSTOM FIRMWARE!! If on stock firmware, this setting MUST be left on "NONE." The latest compatible firmware can be found here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1D27XDjs1T9Nq5rEmTcdS1Hc7cVMUBJF_?usp=sharing

inputtilt_angle_limit.description: Max angle to which Input Tiltback will tilt.

inputtilt_speed.description: Speed at which Input Tiltback will tilt to the desired angle.

inputtilt_invert_throttle.description:
False:

  • Throttle Forward = Nose Lift
  • Throttle Backward = Nose Lower


True (Default):

  • Throttle Forward = Nose Lower
  • Throttle Backward = Nose Lift

startup_pitch_tolerance.description: Angle at which balancing will start (on the main axis). Measured in degrees from upright (0).

startup_roll_tolerance.description: Angle at which balancing will start (on the cross axis). Measured in degrees from upright (0).

startup_speed.description: Speed at which wheel will center itself on startup.

startup_click_current.description:
Strength of the noticeable "click" when engaging.

0A = Stealthy start

20A = Very noticeable click

brake_current.description: Breaking current to be applied when float app is not actively balancing.

ki_limit.description:
I Term Limiter (Limit Integral Amps)

Prevents lingering Captain morgan after freespin tricks, curb nudges, suddenly ending inclines.


Recommended Value: 20A - 30A


*Note: 0 = Disabled (Not Recommended)

booster_angle.description:
Angle at which booster is applied, in relation to the setpoint.


*NOTE: Now based on True Pitch (uses Mahony KP 0.2), rather than Pitch filtered by your set Mahony KP (likely heavily filtered and inaccurate).

booster_ramp.description:
Degrees over which booster will ramp from 0A to the Configured Current, starting at start Angle.


*NOTE: Now based on True Pitch (uses Mahony KP 0.2), rather than Pitch filtered by your set Mahony KP (likely heavily filtered and inaccurate).

booster_current.description: Extra current to be applied when booster angle is reached.

torquetilt_start_current.description: Minimum output current threshold for torque tiltback to start applying.

torquetilt_angle_limit.description: Max angle to which torque tiltback will tilt.

torquetilt_on_speed.description: Max speed at which torque tiltback will tilt to the desired angle (tilt will be slower if current increases slowly).

torquetilt_off_speed.description: Max speed at which torque tiltback will release to the desired angle back to 0 (tilt will be slower if current decreases slowly).

torquetilt_strength.description: How much tiltback should be applied based on output current.

torquetilt_filter.description: Biquad Low pass filter on the current used for calculating the torquetilt. This smooths out spikes in the current, and prevents torquetilt from being twitchy.

atr_strength.description:
How much tiltback should be applied based on ATR Response.


Recommended Values: 1.0 - 2.5 (Extreme!)

atr_torque_offset.description: Amps used for pure balancing, not contributing to acceleration (somewhat rider weight dependent)

atr_speed_boost.description: Increase in torque response at higher speeds. Torque response at higher speed needs to be more intense, this lets you control that

atr_uphill_tilt.description: How much is the nose allowed to lift going uphill when torque is high (you want this high)

atr_downhill_tilt.description: How much is the tail allowed to lift going downhill when torque is high

atr_angle_limit.description: Max angle to which ATR will tilt.

atr_on_speed.description: Max speed at which ATR will tilt to the desired angle (tilt will be slower if current increases slowly).

atr_off_speed.description: Max speed at which ATR will release to the desired angle back to 0 (tilt will be slower if current decreases slowly).

atr_response_boost.description: React more quickly to ATR responses when at high speeds. When you're riding fast and ATR increases, then you also want it to respond faster. Boost is applied twice: at 2500 and 6000 erpm

atr_transition_boost.description: Release faster during transitions; When ATR reverses (dip or peak), the slow release speed can cause a long delay for the nose/tail to get back to normal. This should help resolve this.

atr_filter.description: Acts as a delay in determining the current. Setting a high value here improves responsiveness but leads to overreacting Torque Tilt during normal acceleration.

atr_amps_accel_ratio.description:
How to compute acceleration from amps? Higher values mean weaker response.


*NOTE: NOT MEANT TO BE MESSED WITH!


Recommended Values: 8-18

atr_amps_decel_ratio.description:
How to compute deceleration from amps? Higher values mean weaker response.


*NOTE: NOT MEANT TO BE MESSED WITH!


Recommended Values: 8-18

braketilt_strength.description:
Produce a slight noselift on braking to make clearing big obstacles easier (an attempt to mimic Mission behavior). 0 disables Brake Tiltback, 20 is max intensity.


Recommended Values: 7-10

braketilt_lingering.description:
How long it takes for Brake Tiltback to disappear; 1 is quick, 5 is real slow.


Recommended Value: 2

turntilt_mode.description:
Turn Tiltback Mode

Roll-Based: Classic behavior; determines tiltback based purely on the board's Roll (heel/toe). Can trigger on off-camber and bumpy terrain.

Yaw-Based: New behavior; determines tiltback based on changes in the board's Yaw (direction of travel). Only triggered by actual changes in direction, rather than heel/toe roll.

turntilt_strength.description:
Turn Tiltback Strength

Roll-Based: How much tiltback should be applied based on the sine of the roll angle. A strength value of N will give N degrees of tiltback when the vehicle is rolled to 90 degrees.

Yaw-Based: How much tiltback should be applied based on turning radius and speed

turntilt_angle_limit.description: Max angle to which Turn Tiltback will tilt. This wont change the power curve, only stop it at the limit.

turntilt_start_angle.description: Minimum angle threshold to apply Turn Tilt. Similar to a deadzone, except after reaching the angle, it will apply as if it started from 0.

turntilt_start_erpm.description: ERPM threshold to apply Turn Tilt.

turntilt_speed.description: Max speed at which Turn Tilt will tilt to the desired angle (tilt will be slower if Roll/Yaw Angle increases slowly).

turntilt_erpm_boost.description: Increases the strength based on ERPM. Boost percent is added linearly from 0 ERPM (0% boost) to Max ERPM (Full configured boost % is applied).

turntilt_erpm_boost_end.description: ERPM (absolute value) to end boosting the Turn Tilt effect. Above this ERPM, there will be constant boost % (at your configured boost %).

turntilt_yaw_aggregate.description:
The amount of turning required before reaching max carving strength. Higher values mean a turn must be maintained for longer in order to reach max carving strength.


*NOTE: Applies to Yaw-Based Turntilt ONLY

is_buzzer_enabled.description: Enable/disable buzzer. Buzzer is controlled by servo/ppm. Active buzzer required, 3pin version recommended.).

float_version.description: Version of the Float Package.
